titlestmt.titleproper: BU Records: Native American Student Association, Inclusive: 1993-2000, undated, Bulk: 1994-1999, undated

profiledesc.creation: Finding Aid was generated by The Texas Collection staff, using the STAR Knowledge Center for Archives (SKCA) task that automatically creates EAD files from the Archive's SKCA catalog records.

did.head: Records Summary
did.unittitle: BU Records: Native American Student Association
did.abstract: The Native American Student Association records contain correspondence, contracts, membership records, financial documents, publicity, and a grant proposal related to the activities of the Native American Student Association.

bioghist.head: Biography/Profile
bioghist.p: The Native American Student Association began in the early 1990s. The organization’s goal, according to their constitution, is “to develop the leadership potential that exists among the Baylor Native American student population and those interested in the Native American culture and to act as a support group spiritually, academically, and socially while contributing to the Baylor and Waco communities.” They accomplished this goal by hosting cultural events and inviting guest lecturers.

The most significant of these events was the annual Pow Wow sponsored by the Native American Student Association. The first Pow Wow was hosted in 1994, with annual Pow Wows continuing through at least 2002. At its zenith, the annual Pow Wow attracted thousands of attendees, becoming the largest student-run event on Baylor’s campus and the largest university-sponsored Pow Wow in Texas.
As of 2020, the Native American Student Association is no longer an active student organization at Baylor University.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: The Native American Student Association records consist of materials from 1993-2000, with some undated items. The records contain correspondence, contracts, publicity, a grant proposal, photographs, membership records, and financial documents related to the activity of the Native American Student Association, with an emphasis on materials related to the annual Pow Wows the association sponsored.
Series I, Administrative Files, is the sole series of the collection containing correspondence, contracts, publicity, a grant proposal, photographs, membership records, and financial documents.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The collection originally consisted of seven folders with some loose material between the last two folders. The collection had no clear, consistent method of organization. Although the contents of the folders were generally related to the folder titles, and some items appeared to be placed chronologically, these hints of organization were brief and inconsistent.

Currently, the collection includes only a single series: I. Administrative files. The collection remains in original order. Folders retain their original titles except for two instances: The first folder was originally untitled and thus was assigned a title. The sixth folder, originally named “NASA Membership Rolls,” was renamed “Photographs” because it contains only photographs and no membership rolls. Personal information in documents was redacted. Duplicate items and empty envelopes were deaccessioned.

accessrestrict.head: Access Restrictions
accessrestrict.p: All requests for copying of materials must be submitted to The Texas Collection in writing. Please use the Request Form for Copying Materials sheet. Unpublished materials authored or otherwise produced by the creator (s) of this collection are in the public domain. There are no restrictions on use. Copyright status for other collection materials is unknown. Transmission or reproduction of materials protected by U.S. Copyright Law (Title 17, U.S.C.) beyond that allowed by fair use requires the written permission of the copyright owners. Works not in the public domain cannot be commercially exploited without permission of the copyright owners. Responsibility for any use rests exclusively with the user.

userestrict.head: Use/Re-use Restrictions
userestrict.p: The collection is open for research.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: BU Records: Native American Student Association, Accession #BU/410, Box #, Folder #, The Texas Collection, Baylor University.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Described by B. J. Thome. Released on 2021-02-12.

bibref.extref: Anderson, Nicole L. “Native American Powwow Set for March 23.” Baylor University Media and Public Relations, March 19 2002, Accessed December 3 2020.

bioghist.head: Biography/Profile
bioghist.p: This series contains correspondence, publicity, contracts, photographs, a grant proposal, financial documents, and membership records, The series is in good condition.
